translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Kuṇḍadhāna
The Elder Dhammacakkika’s Birth Story
“In the presence of the Fortunate One Siddhattha,
in front of the Lion Throne;
I had the Wheel of the Dhamma set up,
well done, praised by the wise.
I shine with a beautiful form,
with a retinue and great strength;
Many people always follow me,
as a retinue.
With six thousand musical instruments,
I always serve (the Buddha);
I shine with a retinue,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deeds.
For ninety-four aeons,
I had the Wheel set up;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the Wheel of the Dhamma.
In the eleventh (past) aeon,
there were eight kings;
with the name of Sahassarañño,
they were Universal Monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha said.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Dhammacakkika recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dhammacakkiko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Dhammacakkikattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā dhammacakkikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽dhammacakkika therassa apadānam navama
translated: The Elder Dhammacakkika’s Birth Story, the ninth.
